properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 7:56PM MST until February 20 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW OVER PORTIONS OF FAR NORTHEAST NEW
MEXICO TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING...

.As a disturbance makes its way over the central Rockies, periods
of light snow will continue over the northern mountains of New
Mexico tonight and early Thursday morning. A potent backdoor cold
front is invading northeastern New Mexico this evening, leading
to increased snowfall through the overnight hours from the
northern Sangre De Cristos through Union County. Snow will then
decrease in coverage and intensity through the late morning
Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches with the highest amounts expected near the Colorado
border.

* WHERE...Union County.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY
